Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: DJ_Literati
Reviews.Content: This is a two star hotel. You cannot expect anything more from it than that, but we were pleasantly surprised. We had a spacious room that was clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful and friendly. The morning breakfast was good and well supplied. We had low expectations and chose it for location and price. Our expectation were exceeded. We will recommend staying here and we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out if you are tall...”
Reviews.Author: Jairovich
Reviews.Content: ... yes... if you are over 1,90 (over 6') you could be having some problems while having breakfast... or while walking upstairs... or... there were so many places where i felt I could be damaging my head! ;) Anyway.... the hotel is... average... appropriate for spending one or two nights... but I would be seriously considering different options if needing to stay longer (beds were quite uncomfy). I booked an individual room. It was clean... but smaller than expected. Also... everything looked worn (clean though). The area surrounding the hotel was very nice... lots of bars... tube quite close to the hotel... nice atmosphere... Definitively.. I would be choosing this same place for a short stay... but would be looking for something more comfy if planning to stay over two nights. WIFI worked ok (2.30 MBS) but if you need faster speed try NETGEAR with the same password provided by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, OK breakfast, dated rooms and not very clean”
Reviews.Author: Gigabyte056
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, room is small and bathroom tiny. Bed was not clean and had hair on it... the room looks dated as is the entire hotel , spots on carpets, dated furniture etc. breakfast served for the room rate was OK, internet works sporadically... for the price paid would expect a better maintained hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A bit grotty, expected more from Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa L
Reviews.Content: I stupidly booked a single room before realising that a double would have cost the same, so please check rate before booking, as the room was pokey! Ok for London rates with the discount I had but more a £30 pn guest house rather than than a £70 plus pn chain hotel. Not very clean. There were hairs in the bed, urrgh and yuk!!! Mucky in some parts as probably never vacumn around the edges. No bath and the shower enclosure was rusty. I would not stay here again and cannot say the service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: pauloeugenio
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very close to Bayswater and Queensway tube stations! Whiteleys mall is right across the street and Queensway street has all sorts of restaurants, pubs and supermarkets. Rooms are decent, wifi is free but not very reliable. Bathrooms are pretty small. The continental breakfast and the friendly staff at the restaurant on surely helps you start a good day in London! Would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Hyde Park on your doorstep!”
Reviews.Author: FionaCDE
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot for walking to all the nearby tourist attractions. Love this hotel for its position to Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens, just minutes away on foot. It is only a short walk from Baywater Tube and is set in the tranquil Kensington Garden Square. We had a lovely, if some what cold walk across the park to The Royal Albert Hall to see Totem,Cirque to Soleil but incorporated a visit before hand to The Victoria and Albert Museum, just down the road in Kensington High St. There are plenty of places to eat in the vicinity. On a Sunday morning you are on the north side of Hyde Park, where artists display their work to sell along the railings from 10am onwards each week. The hotel we found clean and extremely warm during our stay. Very warm bedroom, we had 3 beds in ours so probably slightly on the larger side compared to standard double rooms. May find tight for space if staying for a week or more but how much time do you spend in a room when there is so much on the doorstep to see, Continental breakfast, usual selection of rolls, toast, cheese and ham, cereals etc. Dining room busy at 9.30am but like us, most people having a later breakfast. We would definitely stay here again as the position of it is perfect. You can have a nice long walk, half an hour approximately, depending on your speed, down to Hyde Park Corner and then into Oxford Street to do some shopping. Apart from getting to the hotel by train and tube we walked everywhere once we had dropped off our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Once Off Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ellieod
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early December for two nights (2 mothers, 2 daughters) on a short shopping break, Hotel is very central and bedroom was very clean but way too small as a family room. There was a terrible buzzing/gushing noise throughout the second night and very little sleep was had. My major concern was the corridors were soooo narrow and I would not like to be there if there was an emergency, also the lift was very slow and small. Staff were very helpful but never smiled - a smile cost nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wilkisjoan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was good value for the money , we got to the hotel at 10 am just to drop our bags of and we were given our room straight away, the room was on the front,clean beds,tea making ,clean bathroom with toiletries,it was a little on the small side,but that wasnt a problem as it was only for sleeping the main thing to us it was clean, the room was warm and we couldnt open the windows not sure about this with the safety factor but we had a fan to cool us down. The breakfast was continental, it was very nice you could have full english if you wanted at extra cost it did look very nice, the hotel is around the corner from two undergrounds and 5 mins from kensington park fantastic location, the high street is good for a nice meal. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Another night in Theatre Land”
Reviews.Author: atwr
Reviews.Content: 11th Feb 2012. Having decided to celebrate “Valentines” a little early (by a few days) my wife and I booked into the Phoenix at Kensington Garden Square. We'd stayed here a few times before but not for over a year. When we walked into the hotel it was as welcoming as we remembered from last time and nice and warm (which was a boon on this particular day, having left our house earlier in Peterborough with the temperature at -10!!). The Phoenix has a cottage feel to it and many of the original features of the building have been maintained inc. many of the fire places, dado rail etc. With several very comfortable seating areas adjacent to the lobby and good internet access, the hotel has huge appeal to the business and leisure traveller alike and yet, thankfully lacks the oppressive hustle and bustle of modern hotels. The rooms are very cosy and comfortable and have all the facilities one could wish for. Add to this the helpful, well mannered and courteous staff at the hotel and in my opinion, this is a very special hotel and the ideal choice for a stay close to London's theatres or if you just want to "take the air" in Hyde Park. My wife and I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Base to Stay in London”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan_Spence
Reviews.Content: I have been using the Phoenix hotel for a number of years now. Predominantly Monday to Fridays whilst I am working in London. I occasionally use the hotel for personal / family trips to London. The hotel is very clean, the staff helpful and accommodating. Single rooms are small but for the business man looking for a good place to stay - you cannot fault it. A great hotel with good room rates. Great Value for Money ! The nearest tube is Bayswater, which is 4 minutes walk away serving the Circle and District lines, whist a further 4 minutes at the top of Queensway (Opposite Hyde Park) is Queensway Tube Station - Central Line. Paddington Rail Station is close by to the hotel (5 min taxi ride or 15 minute walk)

Reviews.Title: “Do not spend more than max. 2 nights here”
Reviews.Author: Groundhopper
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night. As I have stayed at this property 3 times before I knew what to expect. Small rooms, small bathrooms, average service and a slow lift. i have to say that during this stay I was a bit disappointed. The radiator in my room wa boiling hot, and it was impossible to turn it down. But with help of a fan and a wide open window I sort of survived the night. The room I got this time was also very outdated, and not as new as my rooms on prior visits. But the price for this hotel is still okay, and the location is fantastic with both Baywater and Queensway tube station just around the corner. But I would reccomend this hotel only if you are staying here for 1 or maximum two night.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent place with a fair price”
Reviews.Author: flay_12
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel with my 20 years old daughter for a whole week and we think it was flawless: excelent and clean accomodation, nice staff, served by two tube stations - Bayswater (circle and district line) and Queensway (central line) - walking distance to nice places such as Hyde Park and Notting Hill Gate and a fantastic breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “No restaurant, but just walk 50 metres into Queensway and you've lots of choice.”
Reviews.Author: Gynaeman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in Bayswater. It is a stone's throw from Bayswater tube station. Very comfortable and when I had trouble getting internet access, the staff at reception just took my laptop and did it for me in 2 minutes! Breakfast was OK but I'm sure they had watered down the fruit juice!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend for a London stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Emma071
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix hotel is set in the lovely bayswater. It is only 500m from the tube station making it perfect to come from heathrow and do your sightseeing. It is just off queens way which has shops and restaurants. The room was modern and tidy. Breakfast was simple but adequate. Overall a good experience!! Our window had a lovely view as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good prices, NON-EXISTANT Wifi.”
Reviews.Author: Becksy94
Reviews.Content: Like many of the reviews already state, this hotel is located in a wonderful location...lots of restaurants, two tube stations walking distance, Kensington and Hyde Park close by. Where things go wrong is in the apparently untrained Slavic reception desk staff. They are very unfriendly...never greeting guests when we walk in the door, one female actually rolled her eyes in response to my concern about cab pick-up, and they all tried to blame the non-working wifi on my "American computer." (an ipad2) In talking with other guests from Australia, Kenya and throughout the UK, we learned they could not access or stay logged into wifi either. Huge concern if needing to do business or just keep in touch with family and friends. The McDonalds down the road got our nightly visit to log on. Also, don't know if it was just our room, but we were only allowed one key (a real key at that) to use between my son and I. We had to coordinate our returns to the hotel and divvy up who got the key based on wo would be back first. Silly in this age. To sum things up, brilliant location, decent breakfast (albeit the same exact breakfast every day), inexpensive by London standards, SHODDY service and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet haven”
Reviews.Author: cathmac59
Reviews.Content: I'm almost afraid to give this hotel too great a review in case I find I can't get a booking next time I'm in London! Oh well, here goes! What a hidden gem. Great location, lovely quiet area, albeit close to some great restaurants and all the shops you'll need. Clean...an understatement...my room was cleaned and turned down twice in one day! Modern bathroom, great shower, towels changed every day, great bed (single room), nice modern duvet, room great size for one, flatscreen tv with freeview, tea/coffee facilities adequate, nice touch with Aero hot chocolate drink. Lovely hotel staff...extremely friendly and helpful, even the lovely restaurant staff trying to facilitiate everyone for breakfast at the weekend which was not an easy task, given the numbers in quite a small restaurant area....bit of a wait... continental breakfast was great, and cooked options available at good prices. Nice little lounge seating areas, with daily newspapers available, bar of course, but didnt partake...seemed to be strange hours too. But all in all, a fantastic hotel. A stone's throw from either Bayswater or Queensway tubes, whichever line is handiest, both easy access to the West End. Kensington Gardens just a short walk away. What more can you want?!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible bed”
Reviews.Author: Schubi01
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in a single room, which was very small indeed. The bed was horrendous, I certainly did not want to spend any more time in it than necessary. Overall however the hotel was good value for a central London hotel, the location good and the surroundings quite peaceful. Staff was friendly though non was of English origin and breakfast ok for a hotel of this class in London.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bekkie433
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel mid afternoon and was greeted by a very friendly helpful receptionist. Check in was very quick and ammenities were explained. Our room was a room for 4 people. However they were all single beds. The room was very clean and adequately stocked with tea, coffe and shampoos etc. The room was however very hot. A very short walk to Bayswater tube station on the district and circle lines and Queensway station on the central line, central London was easily accessable. We had a very comfortable nights sleep until 8.30m when we had a knock at the door by the chamber maids wanting to see if we were upto clean our room. After politely telling her we wasnt and returning to bed, we could hear her knocking on all the other doors in the corridor and then hoovering!! It was a Sunday and New Years Day...and slightly annoying. Breakfast was ok. Not much choice considering the price paid and no English breakfast available although we had been assured it would be when we checked in. Had English breakfast been available we noted a card on the table stating it was an extra £6.95p. This had definitely not been mentioned before!! Overall not a bad hotel, adequate for our first visit to the Lord Mayor of Londons new year fireworks party. Although many tube stations were closed on our way home and it did take us an hour and a half to walk back. This however does not reflect on the hotel, just bear it in mind if you are planning the same.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: after about 10 hrs searching for a hotel near Hyde Park i booked a family room 2 adults and 1 child at this hotel. The hotel was easy to find just a few minutes walk from Bayswater tube station on a quiet street. Although it didnt look much on the outside when we walked into reception we were impressed. The room was clean and a decent size, my son was impressed he got a proper single bed & not a put me up bed. Continental breakfast was adequate but nothing spectacular cereals, toast, criossants, fruit etc. The hotel was very quiet at night and the beds very comfy, We would definately return to this hotel when visiting London again.

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute Decisions”
Reviews.Author: Louiebox
Reviews.Content: We were in London on business recently and the meeting ran into the evening so we had to decide to stay overnight. We were in the area and noticed the Phoenix. We were able to view a room and book it straight away. First impressions, of the reception area, are of a tired hotel and this area could certaintly do with an upgrade. The rooms, also on first impressions, are basic. However once you are installed this hotel functions properly. The rooms are clean and fresh, the bathrooms are functional with everything working and there are little touches such as the spotless tea and coffe maker with some nice biscuits. Staff is frieldly and quitely efficient and overall this is a nice small hotel excellently located. We would stay there again which, in the final analysis, is what they are trying to achieve.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but very good”
Reviews.Author: Conrad P
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed at the Phoenix and each time, I had a very clean room and decent stay. The bathroom was small but nice. The staff was reasonable. The location was fantastic. Close to Hiyde Park for running, and to 2 train stops Bayswater and Queensway. There is a mall across the street and many restaurants in the area. The internet service is really slow but if you are staying for more than 3 days, you can get broadband from T mobile which is on the main shopping area. If you are a couple, make sure you request a larger bed. The price was great. The breakfast is edible and good enough to send you on your way. The rooms do not have a/c.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, for what it is (clean, affordable, basic)”
Reviews.Author: MikeDC2001
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix Hotel is an affordable hotel option in a good, close-in part of London. Don't stay here if you are expecting luxury, American-style room sizes, or high-end amenities. That's not the purpose of the Phoenix. For what it is, the hotel does a very good job. I was booked in a single room (twin bed, small desk, wardrobe, nightstand, luggage stand, and a compact bathroom). The room size was small, as expected - this is an older building, and the room was pretty standard for a European single hotel room. The room was clean when I arrived, though a little worn (some scuffs on trim, somewhat worn carpet). The bed was surprisingly comfortable, with a comfortable duvet and pillows. The free wireless worked fine, and the flatscreen TV received basic cable (no Sky, for example). The bathroom was very small, with a new looking toilet and sink, but no counter space (pedestal sink and a high shelf over toilet). Shower was small but good water pressure and plenty of hot water. All looked clean at arrival and was cleaned daily. Hotel lobby is basic, but fine to hang out in if you wanted a change from your room. It was, however, unreasonably hot for almost my entire time there. Breakfast room was clean and pleasant looking, not overly fancy. Continental breakfast was pastries, breads, yogurt, cereals, some fruit, etc. Given that it was a continental, it was plentiful and good. So, what didn't I like? In mid-November, my room was bizarrely hot. I kept the heat off, window open and a fan in the window the entire time to make it bearable. I can't imagine what it would be like in summer - and would think twice abt staying there. There is only one lift (elevator). It operates very slowly, so getting in/out of the hotel around breakfast or check-in time takes several minutes. But again, not atypical for a smaller European hotel. Neighborhood is a highlight. Bayswater tube is about 3 mins, and Queensway is another 3 beyond that. Queensway (the street) is not glamourous, but has a number of food options, convenience stores like Tesco, etc. I'd recommend the Prince Edward pub a few blocks away (turn left out the front door, walk about two blocks, it'll be on your right on a corner). I booked through Expedia and got a rate lower than was offered on the website. Overall, good experience at a very affordable cost.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE!!! Do NOT stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Keraa P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom for four nights at the end of October (2011) and it was HORRIBLE!! The room was falling apart, the front desk girl Alexandria was SO RUDE and the breakfast buffet gave us heartburn!! Our room was located near a busy street, so it sounded like cars were going to smash into our room all night long. AND there were drunks walking by all night long! We left and checked in to the Novotel London West! It was amazing!! Stay there instead! Novotel was amazing compared to this dump!

Reviews.Title: “Suprised it's a BW”
Reviews.Author: Mailmeifwrong
Reviews.Content: It's one of those standard size old English Hotels. Rooms are more like single rooms for double use. It's clean & it's continental breakfast is not that bad. As regards to the service with so many exchange students & immigrants working (not being racist) in the Hotel it can get difficult sometimes for the staff to understand what exactly you want. Location is good as it's a 2-3 min walk to bayswater & queensway stations that give access to central,circle & district line. Hotel has also free wifi , ask at reception. There is enough to do in the area ........ parks, restaurants, pubs ....... If you're young go for it, if middle age still go for it you like being squeezed ..... .

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Steven N
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and being on my own was allocated a single room. I was shocked to see that paying guests get a room smaller than a prison cell. I was unable to change rooms as the hotel was full that night with other inmates, so I had to make do. The room was clean, although in need of updating, the bathroom was clean but again a little aged. The bed in my room was below the window, running along the side (i.e. the width of the room was the length of a single bed), because of this I shared part of my bed with the curtains hanging at the window - I wonder how many people had done the same, so I avoided them, sleeping on what remained of my side of the bed!. Next morning I went for breakfast to be pleasantly ignored by the staff, who were to busy . . mm . . just standing. For the second night I was moved to a larger single room - although again I would have killed any cats I attempted to swing, it was marginally bigger, but this room had been given a lick of paint and a new bathroom, making it all together, dare I say ok. This night I also had the bed to myself as it was situated along one of the walls. Overall for the price it was fair, and if you can wangle a larger room then you will be comfy.

Reviews.Title: “small room but decent place”
Reviews.Author: CGAdams
Reviews.Content: The good: Clean, comfortable bed, quiet room, huge window that opened (even though it had a view of the service yard), wonderful 6' long bath tub, decent breakfast, nice staff, reasonably good value, not far from the Queensway tube station. The not-so-good: Very slow and tiny elevator. Very small room. Not a lot of character or charm. Overall, a good experience. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lucianaene2000
Reviews.Content: In the beginning we thought that this hotel would be a headache since the room and the bathroom were very tight, there wasn't air conditioning (and for our surprise, it was hot in London) and the door of the bathroom wasn't working fine. But, we were wrong. Although there was this problems, the location was very good: just a few minutes walking from a street full of shops, snack bars, pubs and next to two metro stations and the district of Nothing Hill. The breakfast was great. The staff was very polite and friendly. But, it really needs a renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Cheap & Clean”
Reviews.Author: funit10
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a cheapish, clean hotel and chose this one. Hotel staff all foreign, but friendly. Rooms are clean including bathroom. Decor ok. Teas and coffee in room, towels etc. Our room was exceptionally warm even after i turned the radiator off. I had leave the window open all over the weekend (in October) ! The location is good as Queensway offers lots of eating establishments of nearly every nation on the planet. There are 2 very close tube stations nearby - Bayswater and Queensway. Right, here comes the bad bit- We had room and continental breakfast. We asked to upgrade to a full English expecting to have to pay the differnece between the £5 contenantal and £6.60 for the full English. We were told that we would have to pay the full £6.50. We waited for 45 minutes before giving up and walking out. As we walked out the breakfasts turned up. We sat back down and started to eat. After one mouthful and discovering the breakfast was cold we abandoned the breakfast and ate at one of the many aforementioned eating establishments close by. The hotel agreed not to charge us but offered no appology.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in London”
Reviews.Author: Morgan0172
Reviews.Content: I booked the Pheonix for a trip my best friend and I were taking and it did not disappoint! The hotel was clean, the staff were friendly and helpful (helping us on may occasions with hiring a taxi, booking excursions, ect.), the rooms were actually much bigger than I expected (note to previous comments that the rooms are small... Hello people it's london... Space is at a premium... Rooms are no where near the size of north American hotels....), breakfast was great (again much more than I had expected based on previous travel to European stops), awesome location close to the tube, restaurants, shopping, ect... Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain
Reviews.Title: “the only drawback, the size”
Reviews.Author: trotamundosj
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, people at reception are not very friendly but they are correct. Everything was clean and the buffet breakfast was good. The only problem is the size of the rooms. They are extreemly small, to the point that two people have problems to move in the room... If it were a bit bigger, I would have rated it as very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean rooms, would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: PiperToronto
Reviews.Content: I pre-booked my twin room through Expedia.ca and stayed for 4 nights last week. I was presently surprised when my sister and I were offered 2 single rooms at no extra charge. So we ended up in two separate rooms right next to each other with our own private baths which was great! Rooms were a bit stuffy but once you open the window and use the fan provided, it was not too bad. Bathroom was small, same with the shower stall but very, very clean so no complaints. Plenty of hot water. The bath towel provided was very big and fluffy, better than the one I use at home! A kettle was provided with two mugs plus the usual amenities such as coffee and tea. The hotel offers free wi-fi and continential breakfast. Wi-fi connection was good although I constantly had to log back on instead of staying connected automatically. Breakfast was okay - the usual fare was included like toast, canned and fresh fruits, croissants, juice, tea, coffee, cereals and cheese. I would prefer a full English breakfast but it was free so can't complain! The best thing about this hotel was the location, it's just around the corner from Bayswater tube station and a bit further down was Queensway station. It is about an hour train ride from Heathrow Airport. There are tons of restaurants to choose from and many of them were opened late at night which was very convenient. I would definately stay here again on my next trip to London!

Reviews.Title: “October 2011”
Reviews.Author: Gerry1971
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean, good location lovely staff decent breakfast..room was small and narrow and the ground floor is very noisy, very difficult to relax in..

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel in Queensway tube area”
Reviews.Author: BEEBEE4545
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, smaller, older hotel in the Queensway Tube area of London. Small rooms, very quiet, great loads of hot water, and very clean. Nice staff, helpful, efficient, and a very nice breakfast included in our stay. I will definitly stay here again. Best Western Hotels in Europe are typically much nicer than those here in the US. The Phoenix is very close to two tube stations so it's very easy to access all parts of the city quickly, especially in case of tube delays or security alerts. Also, it's a great area for eating, pharmacy/Tesco needs, shopping, ice skating, movies, inexpensive take out food, and uber low prices on London souveniers. Very safe neighborhood, it never bothers me to walk around here at midnight with a 9 year old, after a night at the theater, as the streets are always full of people.

Reviews.Title: “clean, good location, friendly staff, reasonable £”
Reviews.Author: nikki43
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend in London. The hotel and rooms are clean. Bathroom nice and modern. Hairdryer but no fridge. On the negative side the rooms are on the small side and the walls are rather thin - we could hear much of what went on outside our room in the mornings - hoover, baby crying etc. If you are an early riser not a problem. Since it is on a side road traffic noise was not a problem. Staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast was ok. Canned fruit & fresh apples, cereal, toast, cold meats, cheese, boiled eggs etc. There was also full English if you booked on that basis. It is only about a 5 minute to Bayswater tube. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely British experience”
Reviews.Author: LQuinn55
Reviews.Content: First time at BW Phoenix in London. Had a twin room for myself and my mom. Super clean. Plenty of room for luggage. Had bench and luggage rack for holding suitcases. Wardrobe for hanging clothes. Good location for walking to Queensway or Bayswater tube stations. Queensway had plenty of restaurants and shops. Front desk staff were fairly pleasant and always willing to book tours for us or show us on maps how to get somewhere. Made phone calls for us to verify drivers etc. They aren't overly friendly or very enthusiastic but they did a fine job. They let us leave our luggage in the lounge until check in time. Let us check in an hour early without asking. Kept our luggage on the day we left while we did one last walk around town till our driver came. I did see one front desk staffer get annoyed with a couple who were complaining that they had no water in their room. They did have water but she wasn't having it. We treated them with respect and got the same in return. Breakfast staff was lovely, good continental breakfast. Choice of cereals, toast, breads, fruit, muffins, ham and cheese, croissants etc. Room cleaner did a great job. Fresh towels daily. If you want a facial wash cloth, better bring your own, they were hit or miss. The hotel is old but for me it had a charm that newer places just don't have. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay; would come back!”
Reviews.Author: 154913Denise
Reviews.Content: First time at the B.W. Pheonix! We had two rooms for a family of four right across from each other. Lots of space for luggage and bathrooms were good size. Very good location for walking around to Oxford Street, Regent Street, etc. Very clean hotel and accomodating front desk staff. Rooms were cleaned daily. Breakfast buffet was very nice; lots of choice (cold eggs, cheese, cereals, cold cuts, fruit, croissants, etc). Breakfast room is large; however, can feel very congested when (especially towards back of room) when there are many patrons. We were there on a weekend and was very busy but kitchen staff were very friendly. The subway station is very close and quite a few restaurants to choose from on Bayswater Road.

Reviews.Title: “I always go to this hotel in London!”
Reviews.Author: Katie_11_U
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent! Breakfast is very good. Rooms are clean. Size is also reasonable for London hotels. Some rooms are redecorated & improved (still ongoing I think). Very nice stay in London. I've tried many hotels there and I like this one best!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Nova05
Reviews.Content: Best Western Phoenix was the perfect location for us. With two tube stations within a couple of hundred metres, hundreds of restaurants, and Kenzington Palace and Hyde park just 2 blocks away you couldnt wish for a more convenient location in London. The hotel is situated in an elegant block in a quiet location. The rooms were perfectly adequate in London terms with room for suitcases so that you are not tripping over them. The service was excellent. My only little gripe would be that the breakfast room was quite crowded with very little room between the tables. Apart from that I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good accomodation to visit London”
Reviews.Author: RobertaCrema_Italy
Reviews.Content: I went in London at the biginning of july 2011 for 7 day for tourism I foun this hotrl in a good position , south of kensigton Garden, with 2 tube stops close :Bayswater and Queensway. For the London standard the room is very confortable and with enough space. Godd Continental Breakfast , and very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravcl
Reviews.Content: The room like London is in a old building but has gone through renovations as it smelt of fresh paint and was really clean and inviting. It was well equipped and the hotel b/f is Ok for what we paid. The location is good as its near train and buses and has restaurants and shops close by so that's great. I would advise people to stay here and try to get the best deal as for London considering prices, this is quite a good neat hotel. And the problem is lift- you need to carry your bags down stairs and then put take the lift..which was always being fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for us as base of opearations for week in London”
Reviews.Author: SneakerladyNY
Reviews.Content: First trip to London so have nothing to compare this to. Stayed one week. The room (1 dbl bed) was small and the bathroom quite tight but both were clean and served their intended purposes. The breakfast was fine; toast, fruit, cereal, cheese etc. The hotel could use some sprucing up (carpets replaced comes to mind first.) The wifi connection was very erratic. The location is excellent for getting to the tube and for whatever you might need to pick up -- quick food item, souvenirs, post office, and we walked to a number of restaurants that we really enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ethowlid
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 days at the Phoenix, and it was very good. The location is everything for us, close to the Bayswater and Queensway tube. We stayed in room G1, which was quiet and rather big, bathroom was excellent, shower was fantastic. One of the beds was quiet bad, and there is no aircon in the rooms. There is a fan in the rooms, but it did not help when the temperature went past 32 degrees. The room was clean. Breakfast was ok, simple but fine. The rooms need a new look, as it looked like 1995, bathroom was newly restored. Staff was present, though not very polite, not english standard, but fixed everything when asked. Free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: tumppi23
Reviews.Content: Great location near subway & railway station. The hotel gave me an impression of old times like 40's or 50's, the place was stylished like it I guess. Nearby was a great restaurant called Café Anglais, one of the best restaurants I've ever been. Phoenix hotel has good breakfast, continental/old english dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy, and moderate in price.”
Reviews.Author: lajollamis
Reviews.Content: Price is always an issue when we travel, but we still expect to have a decent room, hopefully with good access to public transport, and with a staff that tries to project a caring attitude. My son had stayed here ten years ago, but still, I searched extensively and booked this one through Hotels.com at a very fair price for London. We were very happy in this little hotel in a very eclectic and very diversified ethnic, living, breathing neighborhood with a mall right at the corner to the NE, with drug stores and groceries nearby. The area is compact and chock full of reasonably priced restaurants of every nationality. We felt very safe here, but you have to be of open mind and be comfortable with the unfamiliar. If you are intolerant of other cultures and ways, why travel at all, really? In fact, I have NO idea why the reviews on this hotel are, at times, all over the map. Maybe the rooms vary greatly, but they were mostly quite similar on our floor. The elevator was small, but always worked and only at check out did we have to wait a bit, and only because I am in a wheelchair. The hotel itself, like many budget, or NOT, hotels in central London, is small with small rooms and without air conditioning. But it is well kept and on our visit the staff was wonderful. We were there the week of April 3rd for 7 days, were celebrating my 60th birthday, and they even gave me a card and a lovely box of Marks & Spencer chocolates. A very nice memory, indeed. The desk people were always smiling and very helpful. Every single one of them! We will certainly recommend them to our friends. We had a very adequate room on the front side, third floor, and had no issues. Everything worked, the bath was updated and had a tub with shower with loads of hot water and a great shower head. The beds were very comfy, not too soft or hard, and it was kept very clean and tidy. The housekeeping staff was friendly and always had a smile. We kept the windows open at all times and were comfortable with the fan they provided. There was a bit of noise from the young people in the little park across the street at night who would get off work and visit a bit, but not an issue if you have Mack's earplugs and run the fan. I would be reluctant in the summer on the sunny south side of the building, and possibly even on the north side, as we were. It was warm for early April in London as we only had one day of rain and it was devinely sunny and warm the rest of the week. The room stayed warm on the cool, rainy day. Our bath amenities were always replenished and tea and yummy biscuits (cookies) were always left next to the water kettle with cups and saucers. The complimentary breakfast was not bad and they at least tried to provide you with an assortment of cereals, breads, fruit, ham and cheese, and if you want a full English breakfast, you may order it for and additional cost. We found the freebie held us quite well until lunch while on tours. The juices were not very good, seemed watered down, and the OJ was bitter, so you may want to opt for tea or coffee. Located just a few blocks north of Kensington Gardens, north of Bayswater road and just west of Queensway, you have access to two Tube stations and several bus routes all just a few minutes walk away. One bus line across the street takes you to the Natural Science museum and a block from the V& A. The buses on Bayswater road take you into various parts of central London. And don't forget the bus routes to the north on Westbourne Grove Road. Learn the routes before you go and you will have a lot more fun. And really, if you are up to walking through lovely Hyde Park, you are almost a straight shot from the V&A, Buckingham Place, Piccadilly, Green Park, and so on. You can even rent a bike to make your trek. But if you buy an Oyster Card for transport you can get to practically any area quickly and for a song. Much cheaper than buying individual fares. Just keep it topped off and away you go. And all that talk about traffic being such a nightmare is very exaggerated if you are on the buses or using the Tube. Yes, they are gearing up for the Olympics and there is construction all around central London, but the delays were minimal and things keep moving even at rush hours. Remember though, if you rent a car the Congestion Zone rules are strictly photo enforced in the very central part of London and it works! We never needed a cab. A good bet for the money and if you want the Savoy or Brown's, go there instead! Personally, I would rather spend my money on the fabulous shows and tours available. Leed's Castle and Canterbury Cathedral, for example. Mind your manners and always be polite and you will fall totally in love with this most wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable and secure”
Reviews.Author: HookedOnTravel255103
Reviews.Content: Third time I've stayed at this hotel, great location minutes walk to Bayswater and Queensway tube stations and five mins walk to Kensington and Hyde Parks. Safe area with plenty of restaurants and late-night supermarkets. Rooms could do with "sparking up" a bit, e.g. new carpets and new beds, mattress and pillows were lumpy. Lighting is very good, good range of toiletries provided daily plus tea, coffee and milk. There is no mini bar but the hotel has a bar in the foyer area. A fridge in the room would be useful. Staff were all friendly and helpful. If you have to make a quick start to the day, bear in mind that there was always a queue for a table in the busy breakfast room. This hotel is very good for a solo traveller, as I have been on all three occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, with thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Einzelgaenger67
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews here at Tripadvisor, I knew what I could expect: an average hotel, a small room, (very) good location, but you can hear the people whisper in the room next to you. And all these things are true. I can add to the previous that the shower was very good and clean, and that the breakfast was good, depending on what you want to eat (I wouldn't recommend the croissants, for instance).

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Room, Indifferent Staff”
Reviews.Author: hgeep
Reviews.Content: It was amazing how the staff would never, never, deign to actually look up from what they were doing behind the desk (which was obviously more important than interacting with a guest) when I came to get my room key or ask a question. Oh, except for the morning I checked out, when the desk clerk argued with me about the missed wake-up call, which he stated, quite rudely, "I must have gotten". I guess he must have been cranky because I woke HIM up . . . .

Reviews.Title: “Trapped in a lift and more....”
Reviews.Author: Lily_1987
Reviews.Content: I visited the best western phoenix with my boyfriend, mother and step-dad and my 78 year old grandmother. We had 2 doubles and a single room, and it wasnt that cheap - our double cost £260 for two nights. On arrival, reception was poorly staffed but we were given our key and told our rooms were on the first floor. The two double rooms were small, and i mean small with just enough space to lay a suitcase on one side of the bed. The wardrobes were an adequate size but were clearly cheap DYI flat packs as they shook as you opened them. The beds - unconfortable mattresses but pillows were firm and okay. In the room that I stayed in, the bathroom stunk, it clearly had lack of air filteration, there was no bath, only a shower (although it was a very good shower). There was a small (1inch) step into the bathroom which was a very real tripping issue. My grandmothers single room, was actually a double, however the bed was shoved into a corner so only one side had access. - of about 18inches. This room did have a bath, however you couldnt open the bathroom door fully as the bed was in the way. My grandmother also struggled for space and had to park her walking stroller behind the door when in the room - nothing like a fire hazard. Not only this but the plug for her kettle was under a desk - again not easily accessible due to the small room/big bed issue. So she had to bend down to try and get to it. The hotel did not have a full english buffest breakfast choice. It was mainly continental. On our first morning, the 5 of us went down to breakfast which is served in the basement of the hotel in a VERY crowded space. the tables are all crammed together and there are cheap and nasty paper tablecloths. i wasnt sure whether it was a 'seat yourself' or 'be seated' affair so tried to find a waitress who looked bemused at my request for a 5 person table. We all squeezed in though. The food itself was a choice of toast, croissants, bread rolls, cereal, a bit of fruit, ham and cheese. I had a bread roll and some ham and cheese, the bread was stale, the ham was fatty and the cheese was at room temperature and just quite rancid. I had orange juice - allegedly pure but remarkably watery... I didnt bother with breakfast on the second morning... I thought it couldnt get any worse.... The hotel only had one lift, and it was quite small - I'd say fitting 4 people and a small amount of luggage at a squeeze. So on leaving my grandmother got in the lift on her own as there were already two people in it and we said we'd meet her in reception. The lift got stuck so she rang the lift alarm. The receptionist came over and was not sure what to do, she rang the lift company who said they would come over. She got a 'key' from her desk and tried to open the lift door but it was clear that she had no training or knowledge of what to do with this key. What appeared to be the hotel manager, came swandering over, he looked as if he couldnt care less and went back to his office. the receptionist asked a few of the room maids if they knew how to open the lift, and after some jiggling the door opened, and had to be held back whilst my grandmother and the other two hostages got out. My grandmother was shaking like a leaf, and i had to ask someone to get her a chair and some water... we got a bit of a half hearted apology and then all the staff went back to their jobs like nothing was ever happened. and the best bit.... during this ordeal, the receptionist said - 'this thing happened yesterday, the lifts been doing it recently' - im sorry but im sure thats were a little thing called maintenence comes in? Shocking service, poor rooms, and just a terrible place overall.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: nettyss
Reviews.Content: I usually review the 5 items that matter to me most - 1) Bed area - fine for me since I know most hotels in London are a squeeze. Maybe too small for those who are used to spacious rooms. 2) Toilet - clean but tight space (I cannot move much in the shower and I am small in size). Warm water at any time though. 3) Location - i find it convenient to have a tube station just around the corner (abt 2 minutes walk) but in a quiet lane just a little off the main street. 4) Service - can be improved but i have no complains. 5) Complimentary items - stable internet access and breakfast is the usual basic fare. It is just right for the price I paid, which is good value in London's terms.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: dougwalts
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this comfortable hotel.Room very nice and clean.Good breakfast as usual,friendly staff were very helpful. Free WiFi a great bonus. Jesus at the bar always smiling-prices very competitive with local bars and often cheaper. All in all a great place to stay in Bayswater!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: CristianaT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and it was just the perfect place to stay in London! Just 2 mins walk to Bayswater (Circle line) and 5 mins to Queensway (Central line). Buses to Notting Hill and Camden town just 2 mins walk. Lots of shops and restaurants around. Felt very safe in the area, even late at night. Lovely shopping centre across the street. Rooms are VERY small and dated but the bathrooms were just refurbished, and that was the main thing for me! The room is also very warm and the walls are not soundproof but that didn’t bother me personally. I was so exhausted after walking all day that it really didn’t matter. The staff was very nice and the waitresses were well mannered. We were 4 and we only had to wait 2 mins for a table in the morning. The breakfast was very nice. We ordered cooked food a couple of mornings and it was good! We will certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Look somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: marcikm1
Reviews.Content: I stayed just 3 nights with a family member. The rooms are old and run down. No AC and the beds were not comfortable. I was expecting something nicer having stayed at a Best Western in Paris (Friedland) which was nice and updated. Staff was nice and breakfast OK.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ScottNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: My family (three children, wife and I) stayed at the Phoenix in early April 2011. Hotel was clean, quiet and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Location is superb with less than 5 minute walk to the Bayswater Tube stop. Neighborhood is dotted with shops and restaurants with all neccesities within walking distance of hotel. Good value, We had two rooms next to each other on floor 1 with double bed and loft style single above. Was a good way to accomodate all 5 of us.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jeanslad
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly as do many of their guests. The consistency of the service they deliver is to be congratualated. Rooms are always clean and comfortable, food is of high quality and the staff are always friendly, helpful and of variouse nationalities, so although their English is excellent there is always a chance that one of then will know your language too! The location is very convenient, just off Quensway, with Circle and Central line tube stations only a few minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - convenient location”
Reviews.Author: fairycakes83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in October 2010 and found the staff friendly, rooms were clean with good bathrooms and convenient location for us. We could also leave our bags before checking in and also after we had checked out. However I would warn on doing this unless you have a lock on your bag as I returned to find the zip on my bag had been opened, luckily nothing valuable in there or anything worth taking. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Central, yet quiet”
Reviews.Author: Antony T
Reviews.Content: For location yes. Nice square, nice part of London. Close to the Tube and close to Paddington Train Station if you need to go to Heathrow. Off the main street but still very close to plenty of ethnic restaurants, cafes and pubs. The rooms are dated and the service is average at best. The bar stayed open quite late and the rooms, although basic were quite big in my case. Close to the park which is stunning in the early morning, highly walkable. At night the main street loses a lot of its vibrancy. I would not say it is unsafe, it is just not the way it is in the daytime. This is actually quite an exclusive part of London. Recommend. Just don't pay over the odds, but remember you are in London.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: travel_novice72
Reviews.Content: Staff on desk generally quite abrupt. Room was ready for us at 9am after arriving from long flight from Australia, so that was great. We had a family room for 2 kids and 2 adults. Really could have used a bar fridge in the room for cold drinks, fruit, etc, but the weather was cool enough for us to leave these things on the window sill to keep cool. Room was clean and tidy and bathroom was modern. Breakfast room was always busy over our 4 night stay, but always fully stocked with a nice range of food. Location was great, with shops, restaurants, tube and bus stops all within a 5 minute walk. Kensington gardens was also a short walk away which was great for kids to have a run and play.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: AlisonBeth
Reviews.Content: This had to be one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at in London. It's location was great (right around the corner from Bayswater tube stop) but other than that it was fairly awful. The desk staff were the most unhappy group of people I have ever encountered. Not once did any of them smile at me. The staff that worked the continental breakfast was pleasant but had a very hard time keeping the buffet stocked and the tables cleared. The hotel was WARM. Ridiculously warm. You broke into a sweat as soon as you entered the lobby and the rooms were no better. The heat was off but it didn't matter. The windows only opened maybe 3 inches so that offered no respite. There was a fan in the closet, but in order to plug it in you had to move the desk to get to the plug, and even then I don't think you could have both the TV and fan plugged in at the same time. My bed was slanted so that I constantly felt like I was going to roll onto the floor. The shelf in the bathroom was also tilted so that if you put anything on there, it was likely to fall off, and, if you forgot to close the lid on the toilet, fall straight into the toilet (which you couldn't sit on without knocking the toilet paper off the holder). The showers were nice. Small, but I expected that. The noise from outside made sleeping next to impossible; maybe it wouldn't have been so bad if I didn't need to keep my window open (I was in room 319) but I did need the window open to try to alleviate SOME of the warmth. You also had to pay 1.50 for a 1/2 hour of internet access (I instead went to Whiteley's and paid 2 for internet access with a code that I could come back and reuse until my 2 hours were up). I usually stay at the Henry VIII Hotel which is a couple blocks away, but unfortunately they were booked. I was actually looking forward to my stay at a Best Western, thinking maybe that it would be a step up for me. NOT true in the least. I will never stay at the Phoenix Hotel again and will definitely be wary of ANY Best Western, no matter what country it's in.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid hotel,surprised not rated more highly”
Reviews.Author: HuttonsHonley
Reviews.Content: I have been using this hotel for a number of years off and on. If you need someone safe, reliable, clean and sensibly priced then look no further. This is a very safe bed if you need somewhere to rest your head in Central London. DO NOT be ripped off by much more expensive hotels. I was attending meetings in Paddington but a short cab/tube ride and you can be in the heart of Bayswater staying here. Never had a problem and even been fortunate enough to be upgraded on a couple of ocassions to some of the really very attractive suites/larger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelExpertOmahaNE
Reviews.Content: While the location cannot be beat, it's the friendly staff and the comfortable accommodations that bring us back to the Phoenix, year after year with a theater group. That first shower after an overnight transatlantic is heaven, great showerheads and water pressure, then step out and envelope oneself in the biggest fluffiest white bath towel.Take a brief nap and you're ready to take on the sights just outside your door. Two underground stations within easy walking distance ease getting around London. The breakfast is superb. We wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wi-Fi Internet Access is an Unusable Trickle”
Reviews.Author: writejeff
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly nice budget hotel (I paid $85 a night on Expedia) -- room is cozy and clean (somewhat disturbing stains on bedspread, but otherwise fine), it's quiet at night, staff is nice, and location is great -- but the advertised free Wi-Fi access is so slow it's unusable. If Internet access is as important to your work as it is to mine, I'd look for another option. It's frustrating -- this is a very comfortable, pleasant hotel for the price, but dialup Internet speeds are a real problem when trying to stay up to date on work...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kangam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pricey but then again most things are in london. It's about a 2 minute walk to Bayswater tube station and about 5 minute walk to Queens park tube station. Bayswater is a great area with lots of places to eat and lots of pubs. Staff were friendly and the breakfast is a good start to the day, nice choice of food. It's a clean hotel but looking old. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, good central hotel for London”
Reviews.Author: malrose39
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel for a weekend stay at the end of January 2011. Whilst our double room (Room 101 !!) was somewhat cosy it was clean, everything worked and the king size bed was extremely comfortable with good pillows. Continental breakfas was enjoyable, good selection and plenty of it for everyone. Only drawback would be that the fruit juices tasted somewhat watery, but we didn't allow that to spoil the weekend, and the hotel is literally 3 minutes walk from the tube station at Bayswater. Would definately use again.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: maureenmorris
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel several times and have done so for a year for a number of years. The standard remains high. The hotel is very clean, comfortable and very welcoming. The breakfast choice is excellent and the staff most professional and friendly. We always look forward to our visit to the Phoenix and are never disappointed,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: palmiro58
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well located in London, Reception very Helpful especially the Italian Gay Giuseppe and the Spanish Maribel........Good choice of Breakfast, good value, near tube Circle line and Central line Also near the Whitleys shopping Center where you can find a big shop with all Italian fashion at good rate!!!!!!! If you visit London go to the Phoenix...

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient, near to Baywaters tube station but...”
Reviews.Author: Zee_KL
Reviews.Content: The Hotel location is very convenient, near to the shops and Whitley Shopping Mall. Staff are mostly friendly except for one with the blonde hair. Room is clean enough for me. But if you expecting a nice interior this hotel is not for you cos the furniture is a bit old skool. Few things that bother me, the wall is too thin, you can hear the next room guests talking and the entrance doors have no self closing which you can hear them slamming. The final night was a bit miserable for me cos the room was smokey for some inconsiderate guests couldnt even diffrentiate between smoking and non-smoking room. Have complaint but no action taken. There's only one small lift to go up and down. If the lift is full, there's no stairs nearby for you to use. There's no ramp at the main lobby entrance, quite a hassle if you have a big and heavy luggage. Even when to get to the lift there's another few steps down that you will have to take. Then again if most of the time you are out, then this place is maybe suitable for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value.”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen1819
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on reviews on TripAdvisor and was very pleased with the choice. The hotel is great for the budget traveler. I had a single room, which was small, but that is the norm for hotels in London. My room had a single bed, a TV, a fan, bathroom and electric kettle. The room and the bathroom were extremely clean. The room could use a bit of an update, but for the price I didn't mind. I just needed a place to sleep after spending all day sightseeing. Breakfast was served every morning. My room with Expedia included a continental breakfast which was enough to start the day. Choices included: tea or coffee, toast, croissants, jams and jellies, meat slices and cheese, fresh fruit and juices. For an extra price, you can get an English breakfast. The location was amazing. I took the Heathrow Connect into Paddington Station for 7.90 GBP. The price is more than 1/2 the price of the Heathrow Express. I decided to travel into the city by the Heathrow Connect because I did not want to lug my luggage up or down the stairs in the 2 nearby Tube stations to the hotel. The walk from Paddington was about 15 minutes - all level and easily done with a wheeled suitcase. The neighborhood was perfect. Looking on the map, it seems to straddle the border of Notting Hill and Bayswater. Lots of good ethnic restaurants in all directions. Down at the corner you will find Whiteley's shopping center. Good restaurants on the 3rd floor. There is a Marks & Spencer on the first floor that has an outstanding food section. So if you want to load up on gourmet sandwiches, drinks, baked goods, etc., for a trip, try here first. In addition, this location of Marks & Spencer also had a clothing section. So if your luggage doesn't show up with you, you can always buy something to tide you over. The staff at the hotel were always extremely helpful. The housekeeping staff is very hard working. Tip: if the London Underground goes on strike, the Heathrow Connect and the Heathrow Express still are operational.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Budget Travellers”
Reviews.Author: melissa_f23
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for 5 nights in November 2010. We mainly needed an affordable place to stay in a safe area in close proximity to all the touristy places/nightlife in London, and the Best Western Phoenix was the right place. It's located right off of Queensway Road in Bayswater (a very cute area). Queensway Road is filled with restaurants/small shops. It's also home to 2 tube stations (the Bayswater stop on the Circle and District lines, and the Queensway stop on the Central line)--this made it EXTREMELY easy to get anywhere we needed to go. There were also a lot of buses in the immediate area. Also, Notting Hill/the Portobello Road Market is in walking distance from the hotel. In terms of the actual hotel, it was great for our needs: a place to sleep at night, get ready for a day of sightseeing, and to take a nap at before going out at night--that sort of thing. It is by no means a luxury establishment, but it did the job. If you're on a budget and are looking for a relatively quiet place to stay that's not far from all the hustle and bustle of London, this is the place. Other random perks: free wifi, and an on-site bar that's open until about 1am (which came in handy when everything else in the area was closed).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and functional, and good vale”
Reviews.Author: Shaun321
Reviews.Content: A stonesthrow from Queensway in an attractive stucco facade building, this hotel served up good value. The single room however was tiny and if you planned to spend any time in it, upgrade to a double, at which point the value is less attractive. Disappointed (especially given the tiny room) that the bar only opens at 5 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: PJALeics
Reviews.Content: My wife, friend and I stayed at the Phoenix as we were attending a show at the O2. When we arrived we were welcomed rather abruptly but this later changed and was pleasent on entry and exit of the hotel. Both rooms were well appointed both the double room and single room had enough room to move around easily and both the rooms and bathrooms were clean and tidy. The rooms do need some updating in terms of the television and the availability of only the 5 standard channels, don't expect Sky but freeview would have been nice. The only issue both rooms had were that they were extremly warm and therefore windows were open which did lead to hearing outside noise, but this was not too intrusive. Breakfast was continental with a large selection of cereals, toast, breads, juices, cheese, meats and tea / coffee. Full English breakfast was available at an extra cost. The bar needs an extra mention the bar tender was extremely attentive, friendly and made this area of the hotel pleasent just to hang around in for a night cap having come in. Ideal location for lots of local shops, restaurants and cinema plus 2 underground stations witin 5 minute walk. Close to Hyde Park and 2 stops to top of Oxford street. Good Car Park Queensway Westminster Council safe and secure 10 minute walk away from hotel and can book in advance to save money if staying for a long weekend etc... on there website. Only real issue is a bit of an update, other than that a really pleasent stay. Well done would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: jjohnboy32
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend break in London and at the Pheonix. Review. Excellent location, just a short 5 min walk to Bayswater Tube and another 2 mins to Queensway. The hotel is good value for money with breakfast included (Continental) Full english can be bought for an extra £6.50. Staff all very pleasant and helpful. Very clean rooms and hard but comfortable beds. Shower was great and hot water plentiful. If going to London again would def stay here.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NepeanCanteach
Reviews.Content: After much searching for a hotel which could take three adults at a reasonable price, we found the Phoenix. It turned out to be exactly what we needed. The location is great - near the subway, near restaurants and across the road a mall with a grocery store. The price included breakfast. The room was basic but very clean. The beds were comfortable and the lighting was great for reading, There was construction close to the hotel which started at eight in the morning but it didn't bother us as we were already up and about. There's a lot to see in London. The front desk was hepful and efficient. Overall, this turned out to be a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: BensMom2
Reviews.Content: Traveling in London with friends and my job was to find the hotel. I wanted a good location, decent rates, breakfast included and at least 3 stars. Well I found the perfect hotel for our needs. Located near Kensington Park, Notting Hill, Queensway Road, the hotel was situated in a residential area but a short walk away from a beautiful park, shopping both for souvenirs and the wonderful Portobello Market, a mall with an H & M clothing store (always a plus), food stores, and several really good neighborhood restaurants. The front desk staff was very accomodating, making us taxi reservations when needed and giving precise directions. The rooms were comfortable, nothing extravagant but clean. The included continental breakfast was very good - croissants, jams, ham, cereals, fresh fruit/yogurts, all you could ask for. Complimentary internet as well as a computer on the first floor for guests' use. I would definitely stay here again with my family!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Queenmonkey
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at this hotel. Chose this hotel because it seemed to have to best reviews on trip advisor and location seemed good. The hotel was brilliant for the money, we had a standard twin bedroom, nice and spacious, and very clean, if a little hot at night but you can open window, and we had a fan as well. Breakfast was continental but loads of choice - you can pay for cooked breakfast which was cheap enough. Reception staff nice enough-not rude or moody which is a nice change. Location is fantastic, Bayswater tube a short walk around the corner one way... and the other way you can walk into Notting Hill in about 10-15 mins. Bayswater itself has a lot to offer. The whole stay was brilliant. Hopefully going back this year. Just couldn't fault it for the money paid!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Rhristou
Reviews.Content: We traveled to London with a large group of family for a wedding. The Phoenix was comfortable for all ages. Ask for a room away from the street, however, because the noise does not stop until well into the night. The breakfast was very good. Rooms were clean and had very modern bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us”
Reviews.Author: BKKC2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as a "last minute" hotel. The original hotel we had booked wasn't exactly what our family had in mind. This hotel had a room available for 4, so we took it. Luckily, the weather wasn't bad...it wasn't too hot. The hotel does not have A/C. We were able to drop our luggage off before check in. The staff was pleasant. Location was fine. We really enjoyed our stay here. Of course, room was smaller than what American's are accustomed to, but it still worked for our family of 4. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: kengedahl
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Next to a shopping center and 5-7 minutes walk from two tube stations, while Paddington is only a good 15 min walk away. The neighbourhood is nice with lots of restaurants. The hotel is quite old. I arrived at 10am and just wanted to store my luggage until check-in time. The very friendly girl at the reception then checked to see if my room was ready and 5 min after I could check-in and go to my room. The room was on first floor out to the street. The room was very small even for London standards and a little worn down. No aircondition but a small fan was available in the room. However the bed was comfortable and the room was sparkling clean for the whole period of my stay. The TV was very small but then again I did not go to London to watch television. The continental breakfast was fine, different kind of cereals, some fruit, toast, croissants, jam etc. In general the staff did not smile too much with the exception of the breakfast staff and the girl from the first day. One minor concern though - one day I forgot my room key and asked in the reception for help. The girl then gave me some kind of system key so I could fetch my room key. I guess she should have escorted me to my room in order to secure that I did not open other rooms. I did get my key and apart from this little incident I was very happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: markusinmiami
Reviews.Content: The BW Phoenix is a small and centrally located hotel just north of Hyde Park in a great neighborhood full of Victorian houses & the shopping street Queensway - also easy to get there by tube from Heathrow airport. I was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness & the new bathrooms, the service and the good breakfast included in the price. The only thing to remember is that this hotel has no air-conditioning so if you're visiting in the summer it could get hot. But overall a great value & I'll certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: debbie503730
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online for a weekend short break. The hotel was very clean , staff friendly and twin bedded room spacious and was looking onto the square....much better than I had been expecting. An excellent continental breakfast was provided.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Lottemoeller
Reviews.Content: We have just been there and we will recommend the hotel - especially for a family with teenagers. Queensway. the mainstreet, is both exotic and exiting. If you are tired of central London you can always find a place to eat for all members of the family in this area. You find two tubes, Bayswater and Queensway, and buses nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: satana66
Reviews.Content: During WTM (a travel industry event) most hotels are full so as i was flying Emirates booked this hotel through them. While the hotel is beautiful, they mentioned its 19th century, the single room that they provided me was so small. I requested them if they would give me a bigger room. They assured me all rooms were full. So I paid nearly Rs.6000/- (USD135) for the room which i felt was not worth it. Since i had come for an exhibition I had quite a bit of luggage which was hard to fit in the room, and had to keep moving it around. The bathrooms were equally tiny with a bit cramped WC and service was nil. The continental breakfest was also not great. Location wise the Hotel is near Bayswater station as well as Queensway tube station with a couple Indian restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting with my daughter in LONDON”
Reviews.Author: Valllentina
Reviews.Content: I had a marvellous service for booking thru the direct connection with the Hotel when I was still in Canada. I belive for 75GB per night this hotel was very convenient for the traveller on a budget. Just keep an eye on the cleanliness of the towels that's all.... The service is excellent , Beds are ok and you get used to the size of the room after one day! The Continental breakfest is included wich is great to keep you going for a good part of the day!! several kinds of juices, cereals , jam and cheese . I am picky for the ham but it was great tasting True!! The coffee was GREAT and I am picky for coffee... The location of the hotel is good : You are at the Circle line (yellow) at Bayswater and if you walk 2 more minutes you get to Queensway the Central line (red ) wich takes you direct to the action : Central London!! I really liked it Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: boondiboy
Reviews.Content: This was a great spot for quite retreat from a visit to London. It was a great base as it is a quick trip from the Heathrow Express at Paddington to the hotel. The Bayswater Underground Station is just around the corner. There is a large 3 story shopping centre 100 metres down the road. Plenty of restaurants, pubs and takeaways. There is nothing flash or fancy about the phoenix - it was really quite while we were there as the road out front had been closed and there was no traffic. The breakfast was a standard continental and was enough to start the day. Dining room staff were clean and efficient. We were early arrivals and late departures so got to use the lobby storage which seemed secure enough and was appreciated. The weather was fairly cool during our stay so didn't need air con but could see the rooms would warm up easily.

Reviews.Title: “Not too fancy, but was a good value for London.”
Reviews.Author: Banquo13
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week and let's make things clear first on this review: when I travel, I don't often stay at fancy hotels and basically need a place to unwind, shower and sleep. The Best Western Phoenix foot the bill sufficiently. I was glad that I was able to view photos of my single room online before I went to get an idea of just how small it was going to be: twin bed, desk, chair, small tv, armoire. No hotel parties here! The twin bed was okay...I could tell that it had been used more as a place to sit and watch the tv than a place to sleep and I ended up flipping the mattress myself so I wouldnt feel as if I was going to slide off onto the floor. I was honestly so tired after my travels everyday, that the mattress was incidental. Just like so many other reviews here have mentioned, the bathroom was tiny! The bowl of the sink was an average size which made me squeeze around it to get in to the shower; water pressure was good, towels were replaced everyday, although I thought it strange that I didnt have my wash cloth replaced everyday. I had to have someone come up and explain that one shower knob was a thermostat and one was on/off. They were very kind in explaining, as I am sure they have quite a few confused tourists! Wish there wouldve been a towel bar/shelf in the shower. I kept the shower gel/shampoo they provided on top of the shower door. Also, the small glass shelf above the sink was adequate, although I bumped my forehead on it a couple times while rinsing off my face. Ouch! Continental breakfast was satisfying, with various cold cereals, meats, cheeses, breads, etc. Thought it odd that I had to wait to be seated when there were plenty of seats, but perhaps they wanted to give this experience a more restaurant touch. The breakfast was one of the chosing factors in staying here, and it did the job to keep me sated for the morning portion of my London touring. The location of the hotel was excellent; very quiet street. I had nice view of trees (a small park?) from my window. The Bayswater Tube station was only a few minute walk and Kensington Gardens was also a quick walk of a couple blocks. The area around the corner was a bustling area of restaurants (fast food and otherwise), and shops that were very convenient. Was nice to spend one pound for an hour at an internet cafe, (instead of hauling my laptop with me) then get a snack on the way out of this small convenience store to take back to the hotel later at night. Complaints? Well, the lift for all 4 floors was slow and small, so I would sometimes take the back firestairs which were right outside my room. I also thought that hallways and lift were unbelievably warm (lots of halogen bulbs). I suppose that London tends to be cool/cold and this mightve felt nice is it wasnt early June. I guess the place could use an update for the rooms, but thats is incidental. Staff and service was excellent. Called down to front desk to get an ironing board and iron and on another occasion needed another box of tissue.(nothing like traveling while sick! Bleh!) Both times, the items were brought up immediately to my room even though there was no urgency on my part.

Reviews.Title: “Good, reasonably priced hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: I_always_notice
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in a clean, comfortable room. Front desk staff friendly and helpful. Free use of internet (but slow). Excellent breakfast included. Easy walk to 2 subway stations (different lines). Excellent restaurants nearby on Westbourne Grove. Small safety deposit boxes (like in a bank) at front desk and a suitcase storage room for early arrivals. Only drawback (which didn't affect us) would be the lack of air condtioning.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again - hotel in nice location.”
Reviews.Author: sandybenj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel was in a quiet area of kensington. The Queensway tube station was a 3 minute walk away (but was closed!) Bayswater tube station was 10 minutes away. There were a number of pubs/restaurants on the high-street near ther hotel. The hotel itself was clean and nice. The room was small but it was adequate. It was clean and tidy. There was a bar downstairs at reception, but there wasn't much choice for drinks! An english breakfeast wasn't included in the price, had to pay extra for this. We had continental breakfest each morning but it was very bland! Overall we would stay here again because it is in a good location, and would recomend the hotel to friends. However we felt it was a bit pricey for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: Travelling81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the bayswater area, which is reasonably central and quite a cosy area. The rooms are very small, and the bathroom even smaller. But they are clean and the staff is helpful and friendly. Free wifi is of course an extra point to mention. With a bit of luggage it is hard to fit in the room, and you will keep shuffling bags around which is an annoyance. Beds are somewhat uncomfortable and well used, but still it did not interfere with my sleep. The continental breakfast is again ok, and nice to have included, but having stayed at multiple hotels and b&bs in the UK this is below average, or just around average. If you are on a tight budget, this could be an option.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable and clean in a good location - good if you are on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: PJZinLA
